### Steps to reproduce
文档中说：
Vue 还对应 addEventListener 中的 passive 选项提供了 .passive 修饰符。
官网的VUE文档感觉有问题呢，查资料发现，passive只针对touchstart和touchend以及whell，并没有针对scroll事件进行优化，，而且在https://rbyers.github.io/scroll-latency.html地址中也正是针对这几个事件进行测试的

无

---
为了严谨，请确定一下

Issues.Title: Accessing root DOM-element of current component by some selector
Issues.Body: ### What problem does this feature solve? For example, we have many different components and we want to access the first div and assign some style to it. But now we have to specify some unique id (class) for every component. ``` ``` We could use something like div:first-of-type but it will be passed to any nested components. ### What does the proposed API look like? Can we have something like this: ``` ``` But currently :root is used for another functionality (variables). No matter which name it would be, just need some ability to access the first DOM node IN THIS component. So in new component we just put this alias and access the first node without id, class etc.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accessing root DOM-element of current component by some selector" (#11657)

Issues.Title: Vue v-on:click on the select box works slow(Works after 2nd Click)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[http://deepakcardoza.epizy.com/?i=1](http://deepakcardoza.epizy.com/?i=1)







### Steps to reproduce
I want my Vue js Function to run immediately after selecting each one of the select box option. It works fine on the PC.But in mobile devices "V-on:click-"function()" doesnt work fast. First time when option is selected it does not call the Function. It calls the function or V-on click works only after second click on the select box.

### What is expected?
Expected to call the function immediately on first click of select box/option value.(In mobile device)

### What is actually happening?
It calls the function after second click on the select box.

---
<select v-model="bank" name=bank id=bank class=select onclick="gototop();" v-on:click="updateInterest">

It must call or go to function on one click on the select box

Please note:
It works fine on the PC/Computer.On the mobile Devices i am getting issues.

Issues.Title: transition-group with flex parent causes removed items to fly
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/turboSheep/pen/OJNQGEG](https://codepen.io/turboSheep/pen/OJNQGEG)







### Steps to reproduce
Click the 'Remove Multiple' or 'Remove First 2' buttons and observe the movement of the items.

### What is expected?
The rectangles being removed should fade out on the spot.

### What is actually happening?
The rectangles fade out and also move to various locations on the canvas.

---
Observe that if the items 1 and 2 are to be removed, then the events fired in the following order:

```
before-leave#1
leave#1
before-leave#2
leave#2
```

This means that `beforeLeave` for the second element is called after `leave` is called for the first element. So when `beforeLeave` is called for the second element, the first element already has `position: absolute`. This means that (while the DOM has not yet rendered the change) the position of the second element has moved to be where the first element used to be, meaning that `el.offsetLeft` is now 'incorrect'. The visual effect is that the first two elements both float to the same position. 

This can be shown clearly by clicking the 'Remove First 2' button.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Similar behaviour has been documented by issue #9713 but the issue was quickly closed in March 2019 with a workaround posted in Jan 2020.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "transition-group with flex parent causes removed items to fly" (#11654)

Issues.Title: App persists breakpoints... Sort of
Issues.Body:
We have a Vue app where I have set a few breakponts during development (in Chrome). After removing these breakpoints, the devtools still keeps breaking (at least with some) at those points every time, even when the option 'deactivate breakpoints' is active. I've tried restarting the Vue app and my browser (as well as closing the tab and opening the app in a new one), and checked localStorage. However, I can't find any reason why it should remember that there ever was a breakpoint there in the first place.

The first obvious thought would be "that's a Chrome issue" but I've never had that in any React or Angular apps.

Possibly related and therefore worth mentioning: in the source explorer of Chrome's devtools I always see a bunch of files with the name of the component. Most of these, however, don't contain the actual code of the component and look more like Webpack minified files or something like that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "App persists breakpoints... Sort of" (#11650)

Issues.Title: JavaScript Performance api not working correctly with vue js
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63753673/perfomance-api-in-javascript-not-working-as-expected-in-vue-js](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63753673/perfomance-api-in-javascript-not-working-as-expected-in-vue-js)

### Steps to reproduce
Go to any vue website and open the console and run the below instruction on landing page / main page of the website.
For example [this website](http://frontenddeveloperlove.com/)

performance.getEntriesByName(window.location.href)

Now change the route and run the above instruction again on some route other than homepage and observe the behaviour.

### What is expected?
It should return performance metrics of each route

### What is actually happening?
it is not returning the performance metrics of each route. just the home or  landing page

---
Check this out for details 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63753673/perfomance-api-in-javascript-not-working-as-expected-in-vue-js

Issues.Title: No way to catch a template compilation error in production build mode
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsbin.com/zoniwudugo/edit?html,console,output](https://jsbin.com/zoniwudugo/edit?html,console,output)







### Steps to reproduce
Attempt to instantiate an instance of Vue with a template where one of the bound props has no value.

### What is expected?
Given that the template fails to compile in any usable way whatsoever, I'd expect an error to be thrown so that it can be caught and sent to an error monitoring service.

### What is actually happening?
Warnings are turned off in Vue production mode, so there is no warning logged anywhere. Also, an error/exception is not thrown. Any HTML wrapped in the div registered for Vue is not rendered.

---
Our product is a Django app with mostly server rendered views. We're currently adding in some Vue components as we slowly migrate over to a SPA. As such, we ran ran in to this issue when some of our Django template code was incorrectly building a Vue component. Then when Vue tried to instantiate on the frontend, it was erring trying to compile the component template.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Expose native event handler publicly when passing vnode data to directive.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I would like to access the native DOM event handler for a given click event so that I can remove it in a directive.  Currently the vnode parameter we pass to a directive includes a list of event listeners, but only exposes the reference to the event handler on an element via a private member `_wrapper`.  This is the event handler reference I will need in order to call `removeEventListener` from an element.

The use-case here is to build a reusable directive that allows gating certain features based on a condition.  Say for example you'd like to gate any component or element based on a user's permission.  You could add a `v-admin-only` directive that will disallow clicking and taking an action if the user is not an admin.  In order to accomplish that, we will need a reference to the event handler on the element in order to remove the event listener from the element.  I have found that the only location that handler is accessible is via (for a click event example) `vnode.data.on.click._wrapper` and `vnode.data.nativeOn.click._wrapper`.  The `_` implying a private member.  I'd like to be able to expose this publicly so as to be confident that this method of accessing the function would be officially supported.

The only other ways I've found for achieving a similar behavior would be to use Chrome's `getEventListeners` method, but that's only available for Chrome browser, or, overriding the native `addEventListener` method to track event listeners by element myself.

I think this would be a valuable feature for Vue to support as there isn't another way to achieve this that I've found and would make directives very powerful.

### What does the proposed API look like?
`vnode.data.on.<eventType>.wrapper`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expose native event handler publicly when passing vnode data to directive." (#11632)

Issues.Title: [Request] Remove Redundant Navigation Errors
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
These console errors are unnecessary. Vue Router knows itself whether or not something is redundant, so why not just silently return early with no error? Seems like a pointless error

Especially annoying when you have error reporting like Sentry (and even more annoying when you're paying for it) and getting thousands of reports and having to intentionally ignore them

### What does the proposed API look like?
No console logging

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

main.js:

import Vue from 'vue'

require('../mock/index')

Vue.config.productionTip = false

router.js

Issues.Title: Reset history.current on destroy app
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.4

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/NightNei/5bv7co0u/10/](https://jsfiddle.net/NightNei/5bv7co0u/10/)







### Steps to reproduce
**1)** Open "Reproduction link" -> OK - beforeResolve handler is run
**2)** Click "foo" btn -> OK - beforeResolve handler is run
**3)** Click "home" btn -> OK - beforeResolve handler is run
**4)** Click "destroy" btn -> OK - app destroyed
**5)** Click "start" btn -> FAIL - app started, but beforeResolve handler isn't run

### What is expected?
`beforeResolve` is always run on start app

### What is actually happening?
`beforeResolve` isn't run on restarting app

---
I am a maintainer of "Isomorphic Layout Composer" - Micro-frontends library( https://github.com/namecheap/ilc ).  
And we have faced the problem of remounting Vue apps - when we render the same app second time, it will ignore running of `beforeHooks`.  

Since on restart app `history.current.matched` contains last instance of route component so this condition: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dfc289202703319cf7beb38d03c9258c806c4d62/src/history/base.js#L159 returns `true` and `router.beforeHooks` are ignored.
On Destroy app we should reset `history.current` to default value(`START`).
<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: 为什么要使用 `$parent` 获取父级 `_routerRoot`，而不直接使用 `$root` 直接获取根 `_routerRoot`?
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router
If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
我看了vue router install源码，产生一个疑问

```
Vue.mixin({
    beforeCreate () {
      if (isDef(this.$options.router)) {
        this._routerRoot = this
        this._router = this.$options.router
        this._router.init(this)
        Vue.util.defineReactive(this, '_route', this._router.history.current)
      } else {
        this._routerRoot = (this.$parent && this.$parent._routerRoot) || this
      }
      registerInstance(this, this)
    },
    destroyed () {
      registerInstance(this)
    }
  })
```

为什么要使用 `this._routerRoot = (this.$parent && this.$parent._routerRoot) || this`，而不使用 `this._routerRoot = this.$root` ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "为什么要使用 `$parent` 获取父级 `_routerRoot`，而不直接使用 `$root` 直接获取根 `_routerRoot`?" (#3302)

Issues.Title: [Feature Request] Refresh/Re-Navigate to current route to re-trigger route guards, data-fetching, and props assignments
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Routing setups that dynamically trigger data fetching during navigation guards, and assign that data to component props are very handy and clean to configure on a global level. However, if you are looking at data in a route/component, and that data needs to be replaced/reloaded, you are stuck in a difficult situation. Either you need to reload the entire page/app, navigate away and then back to the route, or setup overly complex logic to modify potentially deeply nested object properties in place (Which is largely unfeasible if you have to do this for hundreds of different routes...).

The solution? Simply reloading the current route as if it was being navigated to. This triggers all the route guards, triggers all the data fetching, triggers all the props assignments, and sets up the component(s) fresh as they need to be. 

Back in AngularJS days, this made completely refreshing a route and it's data beyond simple, as all the navigation triggers & guards have the logic to handle data getting & assignment. KISS in it's finest.

However, it seems that vue router has no support for re-navigating/reloading the current route. It requires hacks or extensive workarounds, most of which directly impact user experience.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Unsure.

There has been a lot of misc discussions about this, for years, all of which have been shut down. Hopefully I clarified the problem space better than other requests...

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature Request] Refresh/Re-Navigate to current route to re-trigger route guards, data-fetching, and props assignments" (#3295)

Issues.Body:

I want to check for navigation-errors of a certain type. So there is the new `VueRouter.isNavigationFailure` function which takes a type as second parameter. But because of the missing type definition for this type, I can not call this function without typescript-errors.

```
if (VueRouter.isNavigationFailure(err, VueRouter.NavigationFailureType.duplicated)) {
 ...
}
```
Typescript error is: `Property 'duplicated' does not exist on type 'NavigationFailureTypeE'.ts(2339)`

I provided a fiddle with the code, but did not get the errors there... Those errors just appear in VSCode.

### What is expected?
No typescript errors

Typescript errors

### Version

### Steps to reproduce
The code uses `this` in the specified line and in next lines in a classic function definition and is therefore not what is expected here.

Good question. An arrow function does not solve the problem since the function in a whole is unbound. However, it would atleast enable us to use `mapGetters.call(ctc.root.$store, ...)` in the setup function. Atm it doesnt work at all

An error is thrown because `this.$store` is undefined

Issues.Title: dispatch not returning a promise (?)
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[https://sentry.io/share/issue/a2b85fb22b50486db8dc0eaa197a8679/](https://sentry.io/share/issue/a2b85fb22b50486db8dc0eaa197a8679/)







### Steps to reproduce
dispatch an action

### What is expected?
the action should return a Promise with catch, then and finally props.

### What is actually happening?
calling .finally on the promise ends in an erorr being thrown with the message "finally is not a function"

---
sentry caught the error in this piece of code:

dispatch('action-name', args).finally(() => state.someValue = false)

the caught error message is "r(...).finally is not a function" while r is the minified name of dispatch

but in the source you can provide a key, to enable more then one store in the application.

https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/83bc26fe55417692f386db9b76634eb58794282e/src/injectKey.js#L5

### What is expected?
The type definition should match the function

### What is actually happening?
It does not match ;) so only one store can be used with typescript

Issues.Title: 请删除 vuex/types/vue.d.ts， 让用户自己定义
Issues.Body:
因为你这里定义了vue的扩展，用户就无法根据自己的state，进行覆盖。只能在组件中用类型断言，来使用类型。
建议将此文件删除，提示用户，自己定义此扩展。
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "请删除 vuex/types/vue.d.ts， 让用户自己定义" (#1802)
